channel.title: El Pudu: Living and working from our Airstream
channel.description: Recent content on El Pudu: Living and working from our Airstream

item.title: Beartooth Pass Shoshone National Forest
item.description: Beartooth Getaway This campsite was a high altitude stunner. We were up around 8600 ft or so above sea level in an alpine tundra. The main reason we came all the way up here was that the temperatures below were extremely hot. We’re talking above 95F as we were coming up the Beartooth Highway. Finally things cooled off a bit up here, though not by much. We still were having 85F daytime temps even at this altitude.

item.title: Pole Mountain Medicine Bow NF
item.description: Vedauwoo Overlook We found this spot on Campendium here: https://www.campendium.com/pole-mountain-area Coming out Monday morning, we saw that quite a few of the spots were occupied. I hopped on the bike and went for a little ride to scout camps and was able to find one within easy reach of the Pudu. The camp is at the top of the hill on the side of a meadow with a cool rock outcropping and lots of nice sites around.

item.title: Hiawatha NF Rapid River
item.description: Burning Field This camp is in Hiawatha National Forest outside of Rapid River, MI. It’s right off of the main road and we camped only a short distance in on the forest service road. This lead to a bit of traffic, but really only like 5 people total. It made for an easy spot on our way from Denver to NH. The spot we were at had very little signal (like 2 bars of 4g) that we were able to improve to about 20/10mbit service with the booster.

item.title: A deer I encountered outside of Rocky Mountain National Park
Estes Park East Portal
item.description: Camp Slanty (Site #A30) This is a pretty nice campground outside of Estes Park that we reserved on Reserve America because it is only 55 minutes from the office. We pulled in, black full and half a fresh to a fully packed campground just outside the entrance to Rocky Mountain National Park. The road was certainly narrow and as Tiffany and I were parking it around the 70 degree bend in front of our site, the transmission temperature light came on.

item.title: Mt Shavano Blm
item.description: Mt. Shavano BLM Overview This was a very pretty BLM area outside of Salida. It’s super close to both Hecla and Stonebridge and only about 10-15 minutes to Walmart. This was our first boondocking adventure and so we wanted to be close to town as well as close to rafting. Good We stayed at the end of a cul-de-sac overlooking the mountains towards Gunnison. We had a ton of privacy and beautiful views and we were able to burn before Memorial Day Weekend; after which, there was a fire ban.

item.title: Three volcanos visible from Pasarella Quelhue in Pucon, Chile
The Plaza de Armas in Pucon after the summer crowds have returned to Santiago
The sun setting over Lago Villarica, Pucon Chile
200W of Renogy Solar Power on Airstream Sport 16
item.description: This was a fun project in which I installed 2 Renogy 100W solar panels onto the roof of our 2018 Airstream Sport 16’

item.title: Museo Pablo Fierro
item.description: The Museo Pablo Fierro in Puerto Varas was a very cool experience.
